isis.stitle: HOOD, GRILLE, FENDERS, AND BUMPER - PROSTAR™ - REMOVE AND INSTALL PROCEDURES - Hood Tilt assist

caution.para: Increased hood-tilt, after disconnection of the hood tilt assist cylinder, will cause the ends of the hood tilt assist torsion bars to rotate into and damage the radiator and/or oil coolers. Prior to removing the hood tilt assist cylinder, remove the torsion bar mount plates from each side of the hood hinge mounting bracket and position the torsion bars so they will not damage any components.

step1.para: Remove four mount screws from the lower portion of the grille ( Figure 13, Items 3 and 4).
To remove the grille, lift the grille out to release the tabs from the tab inserts ( Figure 13, Items 2 and 3).
Place the grille upside down on a padded surface to protect the finished surface of the grille.

caution.para: Prior to disconnecting the tilt assist cylinder, position a padded support under the front face of the hood. Components will be damaged if the hood is allowed to open beyond the limit normally controlled by the Hood Tilt Assist Cylinder.

step1.para: Release hood latches on each side of the hood and tilt the hood assembly to a 45-degree angle. Support the tilted hood with a floor stand to relieve tension on the tilt assist cylinder assembly.
Remove three bolts from the left torsion bar mount plate.
Remove left torsion bar mount plate from left torsion bar.
Remove three bolts from the right torsion bar mount plate.
Remove right torsion bar mount plate from right torsion bar.
Slide both torsion bars out of the hood hinge rod.
Temporarily tie the ends of both loose torsion bars forward and out of the way until it is time to reinstall the torsion bar mount plates.
Unlatch the locking clip from the upper retainer pin ( Figure 21, Items 2 and 4).
Remove the upper retainer pin from the tilt assist cylinder ( Figure 21, Items 1 and 2).
Unlatch the locking clip from the lower retainer pin ( Figure 21, Items 4 and 5).
Remove the lower retainer pin from the tilt assist cylinder ( Figure 21, Items 1 and 5).
Remove the tilt assist cylinder from the hood ( Figure 21, Items 1 and 3).
Secure the tilt assist cylinder to the hood with the upper retainer pin and secure locking clip onto upper retainer pin ( Figure 21).
Align bottom of tilt assist cylinder, install lower retaining pin, and secure lower retaining pin with locking clip ( Figure 21).
Untie the ends of both torsion bars and slide them into their proper position onto the hood hinge rod ( Figure 25, Items 1, 4, and 5).
Position right torsion bar mount plate on the right torsion bar ( Figure 25, Items 3 and 4).
Install three bolts in right torsion bar mount plate ( Figure 25, Items 2 and 3). Torque bolts to 6 to 8 lbf-ft (8 to 11 N•m).
Position left torsion bar mount plate on the left torsion bar ( Figure 25, Items 5 and 6).
Install three bolts in left torsion bar mount plate ( Figure 25, Items 2 and 6). Torque bolts to 6 to 8 lbf-ft (8 to 11 N•m).

note.para: Before installing the grille, inspect the hood insert holes and ensure that all six insert tabs are properly attached to the grille.

step1.para: Align grille insert tabs with the hood insert holes ( Figure 13, Items 2 and 3).
With the palm of your hand, press the grille at all six insert tab locations to seat grille onto the hood ( Figure 13, Items 1, 2, and 3).
Install four mount screws in bottom of grille ( Figure 13, Items 3 and 4). Torque screws to 4 to 5 lbf-ft (5 to 7 N•m).
Close and latch the hood.
